title: British English Phrasal Verbs
description: Essential phrasal verbs from British journalism, conversation and everyday life

sentences.text: Let's _____ with each other over coffee this weekend.
We usually _____ at the park after school.
They had a massive _____ over money.
I _____ really well with my new flatmates.
The company plans to _____ fifty new staff.
Please _____ your assignments by Friday.
She knows how to _____ difficult customers.
We need to _____ all this paperwork today.
I usually _____ at 7am on weekdays.
It's hard to _____ on cold winter mornings.
We should _____ early to avoid traffic.
I'm exhausted, I think I'll _____ early tonight.
You'll need to _____ to access your account.
Don't forget to _____ for the newsletter.
Remember to _____ your computer before leaving.
It's important to _____ your files regularly.
Could you _____ your room before guests arrive?
They're planning to _____ the old cottage.
I need to _____ my wardrobe this weekend.
Please _____ the dishes after washing them.
You can _____ online 24 hours before your flight.
What time shall we _____ tomorrow morning?
We'll _____ in Dubai for a few hours.
When do you _____ from your holiday?
I'll _____ the money I owe you next week.
She's trying to _____ for a new car.
It took them years to _____ their mortgage.
Let's _____ on a nice meal to celebrate.
I think I'm starting to _____ a cold.
It took ages to _____ the flu.
Fortunately, the patient managed to _____.
He felt so ill that he began to _____.
I can't _____ to customer services, the line's busy.
You'll need to _____ if you want to be heard.
Would you please _____ during the film!
She said she'd _____ later this afternoon.
Could you _____ some milk on your way home?
Would you like to _____ these trousers?
You can _____ the item within 28 days.
The tickets _____ within hours of going on sale.
Millions _____ to watch the final episode.
Can you _____ the volume please?
Let's _____ to another channel.
I like to _____ with a good book before bed.
Try to _____ and take deep breaths.
A funny film always helps me _____.
I feel really _____ by their broken promise.
Don't _____ about the exam, you'll do fine.
Shall we _____ tonight or cook at home?
She's not hungry, just _____ her food.
I'll _____ some leftovers for lunch.
He's trying to _____ on sugar.
Things will _____ in the end.
I can't _____ how to use this app.
We need to _____ the travel arrangements.
Let me _____ the options before deciding.
They decided to _____ after five years together.
The couple had a row but quickly _____.
He's too nervous to _____ his colleague.
How long have you been _____ with Sarah?
If you don't know a word, _____ it in a dictionary.
She managed to _____ Spanish in just six months.
